      Alpha tested primitives will do the following: ISP HSR: Depth and and stencil tests (no writes) Shading: Colours are calculated for fragments that pass the tests Visibility feedback to ISP: After the shader has executed, the GPU knows which fragments were discarded and which where kept. Visibility information is fed back to the ISP so depth and stencil writes can be performed for the fragments that passed the alpha test When discard is used, pixel visibility isnâ€™t known until the corresponding fragment shader executes. Because of this, depth and stencil writes must be deferred until pixel visibility is known. This reduces performance as the pixel visibility information has to be fed back to the ISP unit after shader execution to determine which depth/stencil positions need to be written to. The cost of this can vary, but in the worse case the entire fragment processing pipeline will stall until the deferred depth/stencil writes complete.
